Description: Terracotta female figure. Head fragment, wearing hair under stephane and concealed by a veil. She wears earrings. Hollow and mould-made. Soft white coating with black paint preserved arround the eyes. Red-brown fabric with black core. Abundant fine silver mica, quartz, clay pellets and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Fabric is very crude, possibly a Nile silt, though from the form and style, an East Greek origin is more likely (Higgins 1970, nos. 288, 423, 1390). Pencil mark that probably reads '29' (or 19?) on back.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.411) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 81, no. 29) (probably)
